jobDescription:
Wanted: Accountant

Do you love world-changing technology? Do you have a passion for sustainable materials? Does understanding the details within the general ledger bring you joy? If so, we’re looking for you!

You:

  • Have pulled recyclables out of the trash
  • Are really interested in circular economies
  • Appreciate a good debate even with your boss
  • Figure out how to fix it instead of who is to blame
  • Aren’t afraid to jump in the deep end
  • Are excited about building & growing empowered teams

We:

  • Believe we do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children
  • Work to protect and restore the environment
  • Aren't afraid to make mistakes as long as we learn
  • Care more about your values and intelligence than your experience
  • Are committed to creating team dynamics that create empowerment vs. entitlement

Our Core Values:

  1. Commit to a culture that builds a strong COMMUNITY
  2. Foster CREATIVITY to inspire fresh innovation
  3. Embrace COURAGE by taking action despite uncertainty
  4. Live with Awareness and CONSCIOUSNESS of our choices

Join Open Mind Developments, a fast-growing Canadian Mission with a Company committed to creating a waste-free future. Over the last 12 years, Pela has helped over 1 million customers switch to more eco-friendly products. We are famous for creating the world's first compostable phone case. We are now innovating waste with Lomi, the must-have home smart-waste appliance for anyone who cares about the environment and wants to contribute to creating a better world by transforming waste into valuable resources!

The Opportunity:

We are looking for an accountant to join the finance team. Reporting to the Manager of Finance, this position will provide a critical role in financial operations and ensure accurate financial reporting. This is an exciting opportunity for you to join a growing and highly motivated finance team.

In this role, you’ll:

  • Take ownership of key financial statement areas for the consolidated business. Support the consolidated month-end close process, including preparing journal entries, reconciliations and variance analysis.Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards (ASPE), tax regulations, and other financial reporting requirements.
  • Assist in the year-end audit process
  • Manage and submit government filings, such as tax returns and regulatory reports.
  • Support in enhancing financial reporting processes and policies, systems, internal control environments, and identify process changes and improvements.Work on some cool projects, including supporting the launch of new products/lines of business, process improvements, system implementations, etc.

Our ideal team member:

  • Has 2+ years of accounting experience with a CPA designation (or working towards a CPA)
  • Experience with Netsuite or a similar large ERP
  • Pays close attention to details and can review their own work thoroughly
  • Is naturally curious; if something seems off, you want to figure out what is going on
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, capable of collaborating across diverse teams
  • May have corporate indirect tax experience - this is an asset

Commitment to Diversity

Pela is committed to cultivating and preserving a company culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. This means we seek out people with a diversity of opinions and with strengths that will be complementary to our existing organization. We know that we will grow and learn better with a diverse team. When recruiting new members of our team, we welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, age, religion, and sexual orientation.

Compensation $65-75,000 CAD depending on experience
